title: Printer Configuration
steps: Connect the printer to your computer using a USB cable. Download and install the latest driver for your printer model from the manufacturer's website. Open 'Settings' on your Windows 11 computer. Navigate to 'Devices' and select 'Printers & scanners'. Click on 'Add a printer or scanner'. Select your printer from the list or choose 'The printer that I want isn't listed' if it's not found. Choose the option to add a local printer or network printer with manual settings. Enter the IP address of the printer and select the appropriate port (e.g., Standard TCP/IP Port). Complete the installation by following the on-screen instructions. Set the newly added printer as the default printer if desired.
knownIssues: Some users may experience driver compatibility issues with certain Windows 11 updates. Duplex printing may not work properly on older printer models.

title: WiFi Configuration
steps: Power on your Wi-Fi router. On your computer, go to 'Settings' and select 'Network & Internet'. Click on 'Wi-Fi' and ensure that Wi-Fi is turned on. Select the available Wi-Fi network from the list of available networks. Enter the Wi-Fi network password if prompted. Wait for your computer to connect to the Wi-Fi network. Once connected, you should see the Wi-Fi symbol indicating a successful connection. If necessary, configure advanced Wi-Fi settings such as DNS or IP settings. Test your internet connection to ensure proper functionality. Restart your computer if needed.
knownIssues: Some users may experience connection issues if the Wi-Fi signal is weak. Compatibility issues may arise with certain Wi-Fi adapters.

title: Bluetooth Speakers Configuration
steps: Power on your Bluetooth speakers and ensure they are in pairing mode. On your computer, go to 'Settings' and select 'Devices'. Click on 'Bluetooth & other devices'. Turn on Bluetooth if it's not already enabled. Your Bluetooth speakers should appear in the list of available devices. Select your Bluetooth speakers from the list to initiate pairing. If prompted, enter the pairing code provided by the speakers or accept the pairing request. Wait for the connection to be established, and you should see 'Connected' next to your speakers. Adjust the volume settings on your computer and the speakers as needed. Test the audio playback to ensure the Bluetooth speakers are working properly.
knownIssues: Some users may experience connection issues if the Bluetooth signal is interfered with by other devices. Compatibility issues may arise with certain Bluetooth adapters or speaker models.

title: Windows Update Configuration
steps: Open 'Settings' on your Windows 11 computer. Navigate to 'Windows Update' under 'System'. Click on 'Check for updates' to search for available updates. If updates are found, click on 'Download and install' to start the update process. Wait for the updates to download and install. Your computer may restart during this process. Ensure your computer is connected to a stable internet connection during the update. Review and configure advanced update settings if needed, such as active hours or update options. After the updates are installed, restart your computer if required. Check for updates again to ensure your system is up-to-date. Configure automatic update settings for ongoing maintenance.
knownIssues: Some users may experience update failures due to network issues or insufficient disk space. Compatibility issues may arise with certain third-party applications after updates.

title: Browser Configuration
steps: Open your preferred web browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge). Navigate to the browser settings by clicking on the menu icon (usually three dots or lines) in the top-right corner. Access the 'Settings' or 'Options' menu. Configure your homepage or startup behavior if desired. Set your default search engine preferences. Adjust privacy and security settings, including cookie preferences and tracking prevention. Explore and customize appearance settings, such as theme or font size. Review and manage browser extensions or add-ons. Check for browser updates and apply them if available. Test your browser settings and ensure proper functionality.
knownIssues: Certain browser settings may impact website compatibility. Extensions or add-ons may cause performance or stability issues. Browser updates may require restarting the browser for changes to take effect.

title: USB Hard Disk Configuration
steps: Power on your USB hard disk. Locate an available USB port on your computer. Insert the USB connector of the hard disk into the USB port. Wait for the operating system to recognize the new device. Open 'File Explorer' on your Windows 11 computer. You should see the USB hard disk listed under 'This PC' or 'Devices and drives'. If prompted, install any necessary drivers for the hard disk. Explore the contents of the USB hard disk to ensure it is properly recognized. To safely eject the USB hard disk, right-click on the drive in 'File Explorer' and select 'Eject'. Physically unplug the USB hard disk when the operating system indicates it is safe to do so.
knownIssues: Some USB hard disks may require external power sources for proper functioning. Compatibility issues may arise if the USB port is faulty or incompatible. Always eject the USB hard disk safely to prevent data corruption.

title: Internet Browsing Configuration
steps: Ensure your computer has updated antivirus and anti-malware software installed. Use a secure and up-to-date web browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge). Enable the browser's built-in security features, such as phishing protection and safe browsing. Regularly update your browser to the latest version to patch security vulnerabilities. Install browser extensions or add-ons that enhance privacy and security (e.g., ad blockers, script blockers). Be cautious when clicking on links from unknown or suspicious sources. Avoid downloading files or software from untrusted websites. Use strong and unique passwords for your online accounts. Enable two-factor authentication (2FA) wherever possible. Regularly review and update your privacy settings on social media and other online platforms.
knownIssues: Certain browser extensions may interfere with website functionality. Users may experience occasional false positives from antivirus software. Security measures cannot guarantee absolute protection; user vigilance is essential.

title: Mail Configuration
steps: Open your preferred email client on Ubuntu (e.g., Thunderbird, Evolution). Click on 'Add Account' and select your email provider (e.g., Gmail, Outlook). Enter your email address and password. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the account setup. Verify your email settings, including incoming and outgoing server details. Set up additional email accounts if needed. Configure mail preferences, such as notification settings and signature. Test sending and receiving emails to ensure proper functionality. Sync your contacts and calendar if desired. Regularly check for updates to the email client using your system's package manager.

title: One Drive Configuration
steps: Install the OneDrive client for Linux using a package manager or from the official GitHub repository. Open the terminal and run the OneDrive configuration command to link your Microsoft account. Choose the folders you want to sync with OneDrive on your Ubuntu machine. Adjust settings such as selective sync and automatic file upload. Enable or disable the Files On-Demand feature based on your preference. Access OneDrive settings through the terminal or the provided GUI interface. Ensure a stable internet connection for seamless syncing. Regularly check for updates to the OneDrive client using your system's package manager. Troubleshoot any syncing issues using the available OneDrive client tools. Refer to the GitHub repository for community support and updates.
knownIssues: Some features may have limited support on Linux. Compatibility issues may arise with certain Linux distributions.

title: One Drive Configuration
steps: OneDrive is integrated into Windows 11. Sign in with your Microsoft account during initial setup. Ensure your files and folders are placed within the OneDrive directory. Adjust OneDrive settings by right-clicking on the OneDrive icon in the system tray. Choose folders to sync with your local device using 'Choose folders to sync'. Enable or disable the Files On-Demand feature based on your preference. Explore additional settings such as backup, automatic photo upload, and security. Access OneDrive through File Explorer to manage your synced files. Ensure a stable internet connection for seamless syncing. Regularly check for Windows updates to ensure OneDrive integration is up-to-date. Troubleshoot any syncing issues through the OneDrive settings.
knownIssues: Syncing large files may consume significant bandwidth. Compatibility issues may arise with certain Windows 11 updates.

Ensure a stable internet connection for seamless syncing. Regularly check for updates to the OneDrive app for new features and improvements. Troubleshoot any syncing issues through the OneDrive app.
